newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank to issue 4.7 million new shares.
newsitem.headline: Softbank to issue 4.7 million new shares.

text.p: Softbank Corp said on Tuesday that it has decided to issue 4.7 million new shares.
Earlier on Tuesday, the company announced it would issue 10 billion yen worth of convertible bonds with a maturity date set for March 31, 2000.
Softbank said it would raise 53.7 billion yen through the bonds and new share issues.
The funds will be used mainly for the JSkyB satellite broadcasting project, the company said in a statement.
JSkyB is a planned multi-channel digital satellite broadcasting service in Japan. The service will be launched through a joint venture with media mogul Rupert Murdoch's News Corp.
Softbank said when it announced the establishment of the venture in June that the joint company would buy out Obunsha Media for 41.75 billion yen.
Obunsha has an equity stake of 21.4 percent in major television network Asahi National Broadcasting Co (TV Asahi).
